isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - TACHOMETER INPUT CIRCUITS - TACHOMETER INPUT SIGNAL

svcproc.title: TACHOMETER INPUT SIGNAL
svcproc.para: The following discussion is only for auxiliary tachometers installed by the body builder or vehicle owner. It does not apply to the instrument cluster tachometer which is operated from the ATA data line.

The ECM receives a signal from the CMP sensor and calculates engine speed (rpm). The ECM sends the calculated engine speed as a digital buffered TACH signal from the ECM connector to the owner installed tachometer.
